segment.tokens: Jack could scarcely wait to begin
" who lives in the home of a larger ant
connected with the large ones of the big ant
the doorways so small that the big ones can not creep in
the doorways eat up the babies
When Little Ant hungry it crawls up on Big Ant 's back
Very gently it strokes its head
then licks its cheek until the mouth of Big Ant fairly waters
It laps up the drop of sweetness
It climbs on the back of another big ant
Sometimes little thief ants live in other ants ' houses "
the food the workers have been so collecting all the long day
By this time the children were listening in open-eyed astonishment to Jack , who had absorbed so much of the spirit and the information of the old guide that he could talk almost as interestingly
Jack had absorbed so much of the spirit and the information of the old guide
that he could talk almost as interestingly
Ben Gile " like corn very well
" Mother aphids " lay their eggs at the roots of the corn
But there is a family of ants who come to the rescue
They carry these babies over to some other roots , where they may feed until the corn roots grow
Later they carry them carefully again
Of course they do not do this "
because they care for the welfare of the aphids
if the little corn lice have plenty to eat they
themselves will have plenty of honeydew
a harvester sir builds a big mound around its front door
a harvester sir carefully clears away the grass
Into the long galleries of its home it carries a great many seeds
All the chaff hard parts it can not eat
All the chaff hard parts it carries out again "
" Leading up to the big mound " are clear as distinct as any path you or I make through the grassy fields
you I make through the grassy fields
Perhaps ants are too to do very much thinking
I would have to think about a long time
before we should be to do them
a good government runs along without friction
They harvest grain into the storehouses
They keep a farm of aphids
By the time the old guide had finished
Betty was waving her hand the way
" Please sir I do n't know half as much
He has told all more too "
Ben Gile smiled at Betty for
as if he had some pleasant thought in the back of his head
Mrs. Reece was of her Betty
Mrs. Reece would rather have had her the generous little girl
her win all the prizes in the world
Jack has abundantly earned the prize
We have been through the old story of ' Eyes and No Eyes ' with you boys
You Jack have used your eyes
much ought to make you a wiser man
As you look through the glass
that you will never see a cathedral window as beautiful as some wings you look upon from the clear lights of the cicada 's wing to the gorgeous dyes of the moth
You will never see groin arch
You hinge more wonderful than the covers of a wing or the exquisite joint of some little insect
made man hand such mystery beauty
as lie about you in the natural world
All the dynasties of Egypt could not shape the scale on a moth 's wing
All the religion of the past can shape nothing
nothing will do the Creator so much reverence as the world He has created , the world we have about us
He has created the world we about us
There my boy that is a long
for the world will hear of you yet
